cuepoints.caption: Let's start out by turning on the terminal.  There are two power buttons you can use.
The on/off switch is located on the back of the terminal.
Just reach around and set it to the left, which is the ON position.
You'll hear the terminal coming to life.
Notice the round button at the bottom of the Touch Screen?  That's also a power button.
You can power your terminal on or off with this button.
To turn the terminal off, hold this button for about 8 seconds, until the green light turns amber.
To power the terminal back on, push it once.
The amber light will turn green and the terminal will begin to load.
This brings up the Welcome screen.
The Touch Screen here is the main point of access to your terminal functions.
When using the Touch Screen it is important that only your fingertips or knuckles come into contact with the glass.
Do not use objects such as pens, pencils or long fingernails.
Youâ€™ll get the best response by touching the screen with the flat portion of your fingertips.
When the terminal has been idle for several minutes, the screen will display a screen saver.
All you have to do is touch the right side of the screen or scan a ticket to "wake it up."
